main_definition: Plastics refer to a group of synthetic or semi-synthetic materials that are malleable, resistant to degradation, and can be shaped into various forms.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A field in manufacturing involving the production of polymers used in various products
meanings_and_examples.example: The plastics industry encompasses companies that produce polyethylene and other polymers for use in packaging, toys, and medical devices.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Materials made from synthetic resins or organic compounds
meanings_and_examples.example: Plastic bags are commonly used for carrying groceries due to their lightweight nature.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Recyclable materials that can be reprocessed into new products
meanings_and_examples.example: Many cities have plastics recycling programs where residents can drop off items like bottles and containers for processing.

additional_meanings.definition: An adjective referring to objects or materials made from synthetic polymers
additional_meanings.example: The modern world produces a vast amount of plastics, which have become ubiquitous in everyday life.

additional_meanings.definition: Refers to the environmental impact and pollution caused by non-degradable materials made from synthetic polymers
additional_meanings.example: The accumulation of plastic waste has led to severe pollution issues, including marine debris affecting oceanic ecosystems.
